item.title: Portal Gun in EP3
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
With Portal 2 being officially different than Episode 3, and Episode 3 being the continuation of Half-Life 2 + episodes, and Portal 1 being a puzzle game, significantly different to the Half-Life series, I doubt this would happen. If you think the way Valve thinks, they it would make sense to keep the two games separate. Anyway, I don’t think a mere Episode would bring a significant change to gameplay. The gravity gun didn’t change gameplay as much as the portal gun would, and even the gravity gun was introduced in Half-Life 2, a major new game and not just a mere Episode or extension. It would be fun, but it would significantly deviate from what the two games are about. Maybe in Episode 3 we will have teleportation and some Xen again, like in HL1, but I doubt the portal gun would appear significantly. Maybe you’ll see someone use it, or you’ll have it for a limited amount of time, who knows, but I would expect such a big change to be introduced in something like Half-Life 3.

item.title: Portal Gun in EP3
item.dc:creator: Neon_Impulse
item.description:
Super Toast:

I personally doubt that the portal gun, even if it does appear in Ep3, it will be usable by Gordon, at least in the same way that it’s usable in Portal.

Unlike Chell, poor Gordon would snap every bone he has if he missed a portal while flying though the air at high speeds. Slowing down without dying to land somewhere would be a bit of an issue as well. While there’s a chance that Valve might pull an HEV suit modification straight out of their asses to make Gordon immune (either temporarily or permanently) to fall damage the same way Chell is with her leg springs, I just don’t see it happening.

I think, if anything, perhaps Gordon may encounter a primitive prototype of the portal gun that will have limited function, and would break when the sequence it’s needed for is over.

But, really, if a full-fledged usable portal gun appears and functions exactly like it did in Portal, I would be somewhat disappointed. To me, it would feel like Valve spent all of those years essentially mashing the two games together.

Granted, I’d probably still enjoy it quite a bit.

I’m all for portals themselves being involved in Ep3, as they likely will be, but please Valve, please be creative! Don’t just copy/paste game mechanics!

I agree
